conclusion: To solve the problem, I will use the given parameters to calculate the horizontal and vertical components of the projectile's motion. I will then use these components to determine the time of flight and the height at which the projectile hits the building.

The image shows a railgun fire truck with a projectile being launched. The setup includes a high-rise building, with a horizontal distance L of 60 meters between the launch point and the building. The launch angle is θ = 53°, and the muzzle velocity is v0 = 50 m/s.
Calculate the horizontal component of the velocity: v0x = v0 cos(θ) = 50 cos(53°) = 50 × 0.6 = 30 m/s
Calculate the time of flight using the horizontal component: t = L / v0x = 60 / 30 = 2 s
Calculate the vertical component of the velocity: v0y = v0 sin(θ) = 50 sin(53°) = 50 × 0.8 = 40 m/s
Calculate the height H using the equation for vertical motion: H = v0y t - 1/2 gt^2 = 40 × 2 - 1/2 × 10 × 2^2 = 80 - 20 = 60 m
